intro: Verbascum firuzabadicum, commonly known as the Persian mullein, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
